jobs.description:
Are you passionate about data-driven decision making, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to transform complex datasets into actionable insights? Amazon Mexico is seeking an exceptional Selection Intelligence Program Manager to revolutionize how we understand and optimize our product selection across multiple business segments.

As Selection Intelligence PM, you will lead strategic initiatives to enhance Amazon Mexico's selection intelligence capabilities, working with technology and machine learning solutions to drive data-informed selection decisions. This role combines analytical rigor with strategic thinking to build scalable solutions that impact millions of customers.



Key job responsibilities
Own and develop comprehensive selection intelligence frameworks across multiple business segments (Essential Selection, Premium/Luxury, B2B)
Define and implement data quality standards for external selection signals, ensuring high accuracy and relevance
Partner with global teams to build and maintain selection monitoring mechanisms and dashboards
Lead relationships with external data providers to expand and optimize selection signals
Collaborate with InTech teams to leverage AI/ML capabilities for selection optimization
Drive the development of mental models for complex selection spaces (unbranded, emerging brands, substitutes)
Build and maintain selection performance metrics and reporting frameworks


The ideal candidate will:

Have strong experience in data management, automation, and machine learning applications
Demonstrate excellent analytical and problem-solving capabilities
Excel at stakeholder management across multiple teams and organizations
Show proven ability to deliver results in ambiguous, fast-paced environments

jobs.description:
Transform network infrastructure by joining our dynamic team! You'll be at the forefront of developing innovative solutions that drive network stability and scalability, using your technical expertise to create automated systems that power global technological advancement.

Network Install Technicians will collaborate with cross-functional teams, troubleshoot complex technical scenarios, and implement strategic solutions that keep our network running seamlessly. Expect to engage in hands-on technical work that requires creativity, precision, and a passion for technological innovation.

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

NOTE: Amazon does not sponsor for immigration, including for H-1B, TN, and other non-immigrant visas, for this role.

NOTE: Lump sum stipend will be provided to eligible candidates who relocate for this position.

Key job responsibilities
- Moving and implementing large enterprise equipment
- Installing Fiber and Copper cabling and patching cabling between equipment
- Ensuring proper safety and security standards are maintained during cabling and rack installation,
- Following well established hardware installation procedures and break-fix activities
- Safely using material handling tools and equipment
- Traveling within and outside of the regional work area is required. You will be responsible for having a reliable personal vehicle and valid driver's license to travel within the regional work area, as company transportation will not be provided

Physical Requirements:

- Regularly lift and/or move up to 40 pounds; and participate in group lifts for 41+ pounds
- Ability to work in an environment that operates 24/7 with an ability to participate in primary responder rotation and provide after-hours support as needed
- Working in cramped and/or elevated and/or noisy environments
- Bending, lifting, stretching, reaching, standing and walking for up to 8+ hours a day
- Ascending and descending ladders, stairs, and gangways safely and without limitation

This role supports data centers in various operational stages. The position may be assigned to a facility still under development, which could require travel to established locations for training until your designated site becomes fully operational.

Essential Requirements:

- Ability to travel to or commute between data center locations as needed

- Willingness to temporarily work at alternative sites during training periods or until assigned facility is operational

- Travel frequency will vary based on business needs and operational status of assigned facility

Candidates must be able to travel (over 50 miles) or commute (less than 50 miles) to active data center sites as required by business needs.

About the team
Diverse Experiences AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion of events fosters stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship, and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.

jobs.description:
Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced ground-breaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?

The Role:

As a manager of the Service Test Engineering team, you and your team are responsible for defining, developing, deploying, and sustaining hardware screening test solutions and repair/refurbishment processes to support Amazon Devices products. This includes utilizing experience in test strategies, both internally developed and outsourced, to then assess production SW solutions and tests, and identify strategic platform solutions to support a wide variety of product lines. The Service Test Engineering Manager will lead a team of Service Test Engineers to develop global service test strategies which align to the organizational goals and cost objectives. Service Test engineering will determine whether solutions will be developed internally or with 3P partners prior to global deployment. Your team will also support the set-up and training across global screening and service locations.

Key job responsibilities
In this role, you will:

- Develop partnerships with internal technical stakeholders and external suppliers to define the test strategy for devices returns.
- Ensure successful implementation into global and regional support strategies.
- Manage resources and investments in CapEx to tactically deliver results in alignment with organizational and business unit strategies.
- Create technical requirements for compliant screening and repair operations through stable and scalable solutions.
- Identify risks and advocate for opportunities with SW and HW design teams to ensure efficient device recovery.
- Lead cross-functional continuous improvement programs which focus on people, processes, and equipment/fixturing to deliver more efficient device recovery.
- Represent post-sales support in closed-loop product performance mechanisms.
- Use, advocate for, and influence the use of generative AI solutions to improve team efficiency and operational execution success.


- Travel Required up to 20% (Domestic and International)


About the team
Amazon Device Reverse Logistics’ (ADRL) vision is to power the circular economy by giving consumer electronic products another chance to be loved. The ADRL mission is to delight consumer electronic customers worldwide by offering an Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) return experience that delivers maximum margin recovery through flexible and world-class products and services.

The Service Test Engineering Manager will be the technical domain leader within ADRL, communicating risks and opportunities while influencing the overall business strategy of the organization. The candidate will regularly work across multiple levels of the organization, ranging from IC to Director-level leadership.

jobs.description:
Transform network infrastructure by joining our dynamic team! You'll be at the forefront of developing innovative solutions that drive network stability and scalability, using your technical expertise to create automated systems that power global technological advancement.

Network Install Technicians will collaborate with cross-functional teams, troubleshoot complex technical scenarios, and implement strategic solutions that keep our network running seamlessly. Expect to engage in hands-on technical work that requires creativity, precision, and a passion for technological innovation.

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

NOTE: Amazon does not sponsor for immigration, including for H-1B, TN, and other non-immigrant visas, for this role.

NOTE: Lump sum stipend will be provided to eligible candidates who relocate for this position.

Key job responsibilities
- Moving and implementing large enterprise equipment
- Installing Fiber and Copper cabling and patching cabling between equipment
- Ensuring proper safety and security standards are maintained during cabling and rack installation,
- Following well established hardware installation procedures and break-fix activities
- Safely using material handling tools and equipment

Traveling within and outside of the regional work area is required. You will be responsible for having a reliable personal vehicle and valid driver's license to travel within the regional work area, as company transportation will not be provided

Physical Requirements:
- Regularly lift and/or move up to 40 pounds; and participate in group lifts for 41+ pounds
- Ability to work in an environment that operates 24/7 with an ability to participate in primary responder rotation and provide after-hours support as needed
- Working in cramped and/or elevated and/or noisy environments
- Bending, lifting, stretching, reaching, standing and walking for up to 8+ hours a day
- Ascending and descending ladders, stairs, and gangways safely and without limitation

This role supports data centers in various operational stages. The position may be assigned to a facility still under development, which could require travel to established locations for training until your designated site becomes fully operational.

Essential Requirements:
- Ability to travel to or commute between data center locations as needed
- Willingness to temporarily work at alternative sites during training periods or until assigned facility is operational
- Travel frequency will vary based on business needs and operational status of assigned facility

Candidates must be able to travel (over 50 miles) or commute (less than 50 miles) to active data center sites as required by business needs.

jobs.description:
If you are interested in this position, please apply on Twitch's Career site https://www.twitch.tv/jobs/en/

About Us:

Twitch is the world’s biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It is where thousands of communities come together for whatever, every day.

We’re about community, inside and out. You’ll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We’re on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we’re up to on LinkedIn and X, and discover the projects we’re solving on our Blog. Be sure to explore our Interviewing Guide to learn how to ace our interview process.

About the Role

We are seeking a Senior Accountant eager to help us re-imagine how Content Accounting operates with the growing capabilities of AI. Your core work will have you involved at every step of the process from contract ideation through to final payout—providing support for negotiation, drafting technical accounting memos, preparing cost and payout calculations, executing month-end close activities, facilitating payment runs, and delivering reporting.

A successful candidate uses GenAI tools both reflexively and responsibly to enhance the group's daily productivity. You are passionate about accounting, thrive in the details, have an understanding of how data flows through systems, and have demonstrated the ability to break down ambiguous problems into concrete steps. You will play a key role in standardizing data and modifying processes, both inside and outside our team, to enable the introduction of GenAI to drive value.

This role reports to the Director of Content Accounting. You can work in San Francisco, CA; Los Angeles, CA; Irvine, CA; or Seattle, WA.

You Will

- Ensure the completeness of contractual records, review contract terms and document the application of our accounting policies
- Support month-end close including preparing journal entries, reconciliations, and fluctuation narratives for content costs
- Ensure payouts are processed by obtaining payment support, ensuring tax compliance, responding to inquiries, and uploading bills to the accounting system.
- Build relationships with cross-functional business and support stakeholders
- Drive process improvements within your scope and contribute to transformation projects including but not limited to GenAI adoption
- Take on ad-hoc requests and own projects from start to finish on top of your core remit

Responsibilities will evolve over time. We are a small team and business support rotates.

Perks
* Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
* 401(k)
* Maternity & Parental Leave
* Flexible PTO
* Amazon Employee Discount

About the team
At Twitch, Content Accounting is responsible for managing the end to end financial and reporting obligations of negotiated agreements with content providers, influencers, production companies, and music rights holders. Our goal is to close our books in accordance with U.S. GAAP & internal accounting policy and meet our contractually obligated payout and reporting requirements. We support a diverse set of business stakeholders including content acquisition, music licensing, influencer marketing, and event production. We work closely with our legal, FP&A, tax and enterprise technology counterparts to accelerate Twitch’s strategy.
